Sentencas: Three configurations of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) micro-combined heat and power (micro-CHP) systems are studied with a particular emphasis on the application for single-family detached dwellings.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications

Sentencas: Biogas is considered to be the primary fuel for the systems studied.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications

Sentencas: In each system, a different method is used for processing the biogas fuel to prevent carbon deposition over the anode of the cells used in the SOFC stack.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications

Sentencas: The anode exit gas recirculation, steam reforming, and partial oxidation are the methods employed in systems I-Ill, respectively.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications

Sentencas: The results predicted through computer simulation of these systems confirm that the net AC electrical efficiency of around 42.4%, 41.7% and 33.9% are attainable for systems I-III, respectively.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications

Sentencas: Depending on the size, location and building type and design, all the systems studied are suitable to provide the domestic hot water and electric power demands for residential dwellings.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications

Sentencas: The effect of the cell operating voltage at different fuel utilization ratios on the number of cells required for the SOFC stack to generate around 1 kW net AC electric power, the thermal-to-electric ratio (TER), the net AC electrical and CHP efficiencies, the biogas fuel consumption, and the excess air required for controlling the SOFC stack temperature is also studied through a detailed sensitivity analysis.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications

Sentencas: The results point out that the cell design voltage is higher than the cell voltage at which the minimum number of cells is obtained for the SOFC stack.
Titulo: Performance evaluation of different configurations of biogas-fuelled SOFC micro-CHP systems for residential applications
